changelog_entries.message: [MPEG-4 Part 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MPEG-4_Part_2) is a video coding standard that sits "between" H.262 and H.264. Xvid, DivX and some less known formats implement it.
changelog_entries.message_html: MPEG-4 Part 2 is a video coding standard that sits "between" H.262 and H.264. Xvid, DivX and some less known formats implement it.

Bring back shader workaround to fix blur on iOS

Add an "Adjust pitch" switch to DT/HT
Fix + improve diffcalc command for comment-based execution
changelog_entries.message:
The biggest change here is to use `actions-cool/check-user-permission` to check permissions. My intention is for only those with write permissions to this repo to be able to run the action via commenting `!diffcalc`.

The text at the top of the workflow details how to use this.

A second, somewhat important change is to run the timeout job on the self-hosted runner, since it has different usage limits to the GH runners. This was missed in my initial implementation, but the limits are appropriate for self-hosted runners.
changelog_entries.message_html:
The biggest change here is to use actions-cool/check-user-permission to check permissions. My intention is for only those with write permissions to this repo to be able to run the action via commenting !diffcalc.

The text at the top of the workflow details how to use this.

A second, somewhat important change is to run the timeout job on the self-hosted runner, since it has different usage limits to the GH runners. This was missed in my initial implementation, but the limits are appropriate for self-hosted runners.

changelog_entries.title: Change beatmap listing key to `B` to match `Ctrl`-`B` shortcut
changelog_entries.message: `B` is also better than `D` because the button says `browse`. This matches `P` for `play` and `E` for `edit`.
changelog_entries.message_html: B is also better than D because the button says browse. This matches P for play and E for edit.

changelog_entries.title: Fix incorrect volume on some beatmaps
SFX tweaks
changelog_entries.message:
A bunch of little fixes grouped together:

- Fixes toolbar ruleset buttons not having hover sounds
- Replaces `NowPlayingOverlay` pop-in/pop-out sounds with newer generic overlay pop-in/pop-out ones
- Changes `NewsCard` select samples from `Default` sample set to `Button`
- Reduces `LoginOverlay` sample panning to match `NowPlayingOverlay`
- Changes back button sample set (in `KeyBindingPanel`) from `ButtonSidebar` to `Default`
- Adds keypress feedback/sound when binding keys (in `KeyBindingPanel`)
- Changes `RevertToDefaultButton` from `Button` sample set to `Default`
changelog_entries.message_html:
A bunch of little fixes grouped together:

  • Fixes toolbar ruleset buttons not having hover sounds
  • Replaces NowPlayingOverlay pop-in/pop-out sounds with newer generic overlay pop-in/pop-out ones
  • Changes NewsCard select samples from Default sample set to Button
  • Reduces LoginOverlay sample panning to match NowPlayingOverlay
  • Changes back button sample set (in KeyBindingPanel) from ButtonSidebar to Default
  • Adds keypress feedback/sound when binding keys (in KeyBindingPanel)
  • Changes RevertToDefaultButton from Button sample set to Default

changelog_entries.message: This was a request from the tournament scene. Reduces the stress of having to get the whole room to ready-up again when moving a newly joined user to the correct team.

changelog_entries.title: Fix lazer - stable - lazer replay round trip causing import failure
changelog_entries.message: You can now export a replay from lazer, import into stable, export from stable, then import into lazer. I don't know why you'd be doing this, but it works now.
changelog_entries.message_html: You can now export a replay from lazer, import into stable, export from stable, then import into lazer. I don't know why you'd be doing this, but it works now.

changelog_entries.title: Warn users about rate limited private messages, rather than warning moderators
changelog_entries.message:
When sending too many messages in a private or multiplayer channel, the messages are silently dropped. Historically, moderators would be alerted to this to take potential action against spammers.

But this was too noisy for moderators, and not helpful to a user or bot that may have accidentally triggered this. Now BanchoBot will send you a message if you hit these rate limits letting you know that you're sending too fast.
changelog_entries.message_html:
When sending too many messages in a private or multiplayer channel, the messages are silently dropped. Historically, moderators would be alerted to this to take potential action against spammers.

But this was too noisy for moderators, and not helpful to a user or bot that may have accidentally triggered this. Now BanchoBot will send you a message if you hit these rate limits letting you know that you're sending too fast.

changelog_entries.title: Reduce stutters when other intensive apps are running in the background
changelog_entries.message:
A small number of users have been reporting stutters caused by running discord (or other apps) and osu! at the same time with game mode enabled. We'll continue investigating the underlying cause for this, but for now I'm pushing out a hotfix which alleviates the issue. Enjoy less stutters in your osu!.

As part of this, we've also tweaked some timing settings to hopefully work better under more modern hardware and operating systems. Let us know how this works out for you.
changelog_entries.message_html:
A small number of users have been reporting stutters caused by running discord (or other apps) and osu! at the same time with game mode enabled. We'll continue investigating the underlying cause for this, but for now I'm pushing out a hotfix which alleviates the issue. Enjoy less stutters in your osu!.

As part of this, we've also tweaked some timing settings to hopefully work better under more modern hardware and operating systems. Let us know how this works out for you.

changelog_entries.title: Add basic skinning support for `songselect-top` and `songselect-bottom`
changelog_entries.message:
I know stable is featured locked and we're not supposed to be adding new features, but this allows skinners to skin song select without resorting to abhorrent hacks. I've implemented this because for skins using these new skin components, we may be able to migrate them to lazer better. No promises though.

I'd recommend anyone maintaining skins to update to using these rather than making huge offset back buttons or mode icons to get the layout you want.

We'll continue investigating the underlying cause for this, but I'm pushing out a hotfix which alleviates the issue for now.

changelog_entries.title: Cap maximum spinner RPM based on OD
changelog_entries.message:
The RPM required to **clear** spinners (i.e. minimum RPM) is unchanged from stable and the previous implementation:

| OD | RPM |
| --- | --- |
| 0 | 90 |
| 5 | 150 |
| 10 | 225 |

With this PR, the RPM required to **complete** spinners becomes:

| OD | RPM |
| --- | --- |
| 0 | 250 |
| 5 | 380 |
| 10 | 430 |

To come to these values, I've taken a mix of:
- Watching players I could find on YouTube, trying to take a healthy mix of all skill levels.
- My personal experience as what I would consider an "advanced" player but someone that has never cared about getting full score on spinners.
- Spinning through a remote desktop connection + mouse. This artifically lowers my skill.

My (rough, biased, not rooted in absolute fact) observations from this are:
- New players tend to range around 200-280 RPM.
- Intermediate players tend to range around 250-320 RPM.
- Advanced players tend to range around 320-380 RPM.
- Expert players tend to sit comfortably around 450 RPM.
- Even top players - those that are considered good at the game, tend to sit in the 300-400 RPM range

Keep in mind, however, that:
- OD is skewed upwards such that it is more typical for even new players to see ODs >= 4. Those at the advanced level, for example, are usually going to see at least OD >= 7 (~405 RPM) which should still give them a bit of a challenge (at least they'll need to _try_).
- Once you reach 6*, which is not considered hard these days, it's rare to see OD < 8.
- RPM isn't consistent - there's ramp-up time whether caused by acceleration (stable) or by the player realising they need to start spinning.
changelog_entries.message_html:
The RPM required to clear spinners (i.e. minimum RPM) is unchanged from stable and the previous implementation:

OD RPM
0 90
5 150
10 225

With this PR, the RPM required to complete spinners becomes:

OD RPM
0 250
5 380
10 430

To come to these values, I've taken a mix of:

  • Watching players I could find on YouTube, trying to take a healthy mix of all skill levels.
  • My personal experience as what I would consider an "advanced" player but someone that has never cared about getting full score on spinners.
  • Spinning through a remote desktop connection + mouse. This artifically lowers my skill.

My (rough, biased, not rooted in absolute fact) observations from this are:

  • New players tend to range around 200-280 RPM.
  • Intermediate players tend to range around 250-320 RPM.
  • Advanced players tend to range around 320-380 RPM.
  • Expert players tend to sit comfortably around 450 RPM.
  • Even top players - those that are considered good at the game, tend to sit in the 300-400 RPM range

Keep in mind, however, that:

  • OD is skewed upwards such that it is more typical for even new players to see ODs >= 4. Those at the advanced level, for example, are usually going to see at least OD >= 7 (~405 RPM) which should still give them a bit of a challenge (at least they'll need to try).
  • Once you reach 6*, which is not considered hard these days, it's rare to see OD < 8.
  • RPM isn't consistent - there's ramp-up time whether caused by acceleration (stable) or by the player realising they need to start spinning.

changelog_entries.title: Fix SR/BPM display showing no info in multiplayer playlist rooms
Fix storyboard `UseSkinSprites` being implemented incorrectly
changelog_entries.message: This was implemented as a "fallback", but it's actually intended to be an "override". As in it allows storyboarders to *prefer* a skin sprite before falling back to a local version contained within the storyboard.
changelog_entries.message_html: This was implemented as a "fallback", but it's actually intended to be an "override". As in it allows storyboarders to prefer a skin sprite before falling back to a local version contained within the storyboard.

changelog_entries.message:
A remaining usability concern was players adjusting the rate of DT/HT, but this information being hidden when perusing leaderboards. We've changed how mod icons look to allow exposing this information when required.

changelog_entries.title: Add `repeat-edge-piece` texture for argon sliders
Add legacy ranking texture
Add edge highlight to "argon" slider repeat arrow (and improve all skins' reverse arrow animations)
changelog_entries.message:
This addresses concerns about visibility of repeat arrows on short sliders by adding a border element which animated outwards.

I've also fixed multiple inconsistencies when compared to stable, including disabling beat sync and having the animation start as soon as the hit object appears. This helps *massively* with visibility, as otherwise the animation may not start until much later. It also looks better as every slider is not longer synchronised to the same animation cycle.

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/778f65c2-a924-49ef-9bab-36410a258f20" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>

<video width="80%" controls><source src="https://github.com/ppy/osu/assets/191335/32113567-0709-4fd4-9ebc-9d6087e2aba0" type="video/mp4" preload="none"></video>
changelog_entries.message_html:
This addresses concerns about visibility of repeat arrows on short sliders by adding a border element which animated outwards.

I've also fixed multiple inconsistencies when compared to stable, including disabling beat sync and having the animation start as soon as the hit object appears. This helps massively with visibility, as otherwise the animation may not start until much later. It also looks better as every slider is not longer synchronised to the same animation cycle.

Allow judging at most one swell tick per frame
changelog_entries.message: This changes swell input handling such that only one swell tick can be judged in a given update frame. This is supposed to curtail cases wherein a user binds (either in-game, or via external tools) all four taiko actions to one key, to knock out four hits at a time with one key.
changelog_entries.message_html: This changes swell input handling such that only one swell tick can be judged in a given update frame. This is supposed to curtail cases wherein a user binds (either in-game, or via external tools) all four taiko actions to one key, to knock out four hits at a time with one key.
